p: The CH 3OH extracts of aerial parts, roots, flowers and fruits of Zosima absinthifolia were fractionated with the use of different solvents ( n-hexane, dichloromethane, ethyl acetate and butanol), to give the respective fractions and the individual coumarins bergapten ( 1), imperatorin ( 2), pimpinellin ( 3) and umbelliferone ( 4) isolated from roots which were assayed for antioxidant, acetylcholinesterase and butyrylcholinesterase inhibitory activities. Also, the AChE and BuChE inhibitory activities of the compounds were determined via molecular docking.
